response:
Imaging is required to confirm demyelinating lesions and rule out structural pathology. CSF studies and antibody testing help confirm MS and exclude NMOSD, MOG disease, infection, neoplasm, or vasculitis. Ancillary tests (VEP, OCT) document optic nerve involvement. Baseline blood tests and systemic screening are needed both to exclude mimics and to prepare for potential disease-modifying therapy.
